sections.heading: Short Title. This Act may be cited as the Bowling Center Act.
sections.text: Short Title. This Act may be cited as the Bowling Center Act.

sections.heading: Definitions.   As used in this Act:
sections.text: Definitions. As used in this Act:

sections.heading: Operator notice to bowlers.
sections.text: An operator shall post a notice in a conspicuous place near each bowling center entrance and exit that reads as follows: "Bowling shoes are specialized footwear and are not intended to be worn outside a bowling center because the bowling shoes may be affected by substances or materials such as: snow, ice, rain, moisture, food, or debris. Such substances or materials on bowling shoes that have been worn outside a bowling center may cause the person wearing the bowling shoes to slip, trip, stumble, or fall on the floor or alley surfaces in the bowling center."

sections.heading: Civil liability.  If the operator posts a notice in a conspicuous place near each bowling center entrance and exit  in the form described in Section 10, the operator, except for willful and wanton misconduct, shall not be held civilly liable for injuries resulting from a slip, trip, stumble, or fall
sections.text: Civil liability. If the operator posts a notice in a conspicuous place near each bowling center entrance and exit in the form described in Section 10, the operator, except for willful and wanton misconduct, shall not be held civilly liable for injuries resulting from a slip, trip, stumble, or fall inside the bowling center solely caused by some substance or material on the bowler's bowling shoes that was acquired outside the bowling center immediately before entering or re-entering the bowling center.

sections.heading: Applicability. This Act applies only to causes of action accruing on or after January 1, 2010.
